author: Staff Reporter
text:
As part of its Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) scheme for 2015-2016, Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL), Ranipet, has constructed a compound wall for Government Higher Secondary School (GHSS), Melmanavoor at a cost of Rs. 4.03 lakh.

K. Mysaiah, executive director of BHEL, Ranipet, after inaugurating the compound wall on Thursday, said BHEL, Ranipet, has taken up eight CSR projects, including this compound wall, for this financial year and the works are at various stages of completion, a press release said.

In fact, another project had been sanctioned for the GHSS, Melmanavoor that has student strength of 450 under the CSR scheme.

Work to construct separate toilets for girls and boys at a cost of Rs. 6 lakh is underway at the school. The work is in the final stages, and will be completed before March 15, 2016.

He mentioned that the unit is spending Rs. 68.1 lakh this year under CSR and Swachh Bharat Abhiyan activities. This included Rs. 10 lakh for recent flood relief measures at Tiruvallur and Cuddalore districts and Rs. 6.1 lakh for Swachh Bharat Abhiyan activities.

Among others, C.V. Rajagopalan, general manager, Engineering and C. Ramiah, AGM, HR and IC of BHEL Ranipet were present, the release added.

title: BHEL constructs compound wall for Melmanavoor govt. school
